comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Albertine "Baby" Marlow, teenager involved in scandals in 1915-17; accused of theft by her childhood friend, Pearl Hyman Nolker in 1915, then later a witness in the Nolker divorce. As Albertine "Babe" Marlowe, she turns up in the Ziegfield Follies and other shows: www.ibdb.com/person.php?id=51466

comment.author: 48094458@N00
comment._content: And people back then groused about how the newspapers were just full of (John Edwards-who?) scandal.  Plus ça change-

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: This picture is probably from her trial for allegedly stealing Mrs. Nolker's $1,000, in Children's Court in New York. The trial began on March 31, 1915. She and Mrs. Nolker had met in Paris a few years earlier, but weren't childhood friends. Mrs. Nolker described herself at the trial as being almost 30. query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9B0CE7D8133EE7... She was acquitted ater a three day trial and sued Mrs. Nolker for $150,000 for false arrest.
